org.openimaj.util.stream

Class AbstractStream<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.util.stream.AbstractStream<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of data item in the stream
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<T>, Iterator<T>, Stream<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlockingDroppingBufferedStream, BufferedReaderStream, CollectionStream, ContextStreamCombiner, MetaPayloadStreamCombiner, RoundRobinStreamCombiner, StreamCombiner

    public abstract class AbstractStream<T>
extends Object
implements Stream<T>
    Abstract base implementation of a read-only (i.e. remove() not supported) Streams.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Method Detail

      • forEach

        public void forEach(Operation<T> op)
        Description copied from interface: Stream
        Apply the given Operation to each item in the stream. Items are presented to the Operation in the order they appear in the stream.

        Note: for an unbounded stream, this method will never return unless some form of exception is raised.

        Specified by:
        forEach in interface Stream<T>
        Parameters:
        op - the Operation to apply

      • forEach

        public void forEach(Operation<T> operation,
           Predicate<T> stopPredicate)
        Description copied from interface: Stream
        Apply the given Operation to each item in the stream. Items are presented to the Operation in the order they appear in the stream. The given Predicate can be used to stop processing of the stream once some condition is met.

        Note: for an unbounded stream, this method will never return unless some form of exception is raised or the condition of the stopPredicate is met.

        Specified by:
        forEach in interface Stream<T>
        Parameters:
        operation - the Operation to apply
        stopPredicate - a predicate representing a condition that once met causes processing to stop

      • forEach

        public int forEach(Operation<T> operation,
          int limit)
        Description copied from interface: Stream
        Apply the given Operation to each item in the stream. Items are presented to the Operation in the order they appear in the stream. The given Predicate can be used to stop processing of the stream once some condition is met.

        Note: for an unbounded stream, this method will never return unless some form of exception is raised or the condition of the stopPredicate is met.

        Specified by:
        forEach in interface Stream<T>
        Parameters:
        operation - the Operation to apply
        limit - the number of items to read from the stream
        Returns:
        the number of items read

      • parallelForEach

        public void parallelForEach(Operation<T> op)
        Description copied from interface: Stream
        Apply the given Operation to each item in the stream, making use of multiple threads. The order in which operations are performed on the stream is not guaranteed.

        This method is intended to be a shortcut to calling Parallel.forEachUnpartitioned(Iterator, Operation).

        Note: for an unbounded stream, this method will never return unless some form of exception is raised.

        Specified by:
        parallelForEach in interface Stream<T>
        Parameters:
        op - the Operation to apply

      • parallelForEach

        public void parallelForEach(Operation<T> op,
                   ThreadPoolExecutor pool)
        Description copied from interface: Stream
        Apply the given Operation to each item in the stream, making use of multiple threads. The order in which operations are performed on the stream is not guaranteed.

        This method is intended to be a shortcut to calling Parallel.forEachUnpartitioned(Iterator, Operation, ThreadPoolExecutor).

        Note: for an unbounded stream, this method will never return unless some form of exception is raised.

        Specified by:
        parallelForEach in interface Stream<T>
        Parameters:
        op - the Operation to apply
        pool - the thread pool.

      • filter

        public Stream<T> filter(Predicate<T> filter)
        Description copied from interface: Stream
        Transform the stream by creating a view that consists of only the items that match the given Predicate.
        Specified by:
        filter in interface Stream<T>
        Parameters:
        filter - the predicate
        Returns:
        a new stream consisting of the matched items from this stream
